summary_and_description: Saved pages corrupt binary data URIs when containing embedded resources When saving pages that use data: URIs for inline resources (e.g., base64-encoded images), the saved filesystem paths improperly escape the URI scheme markers, breaking resource resolution. Reproduction steps: 1. Save a page containing elements like 2. Open saved page locally Actual Results: Resources fail to load with errors like: "Not allowed to load local resource: data%3Aimage/png;base64,..." Expected Behavior: data: URIs should maintain original formatting in saved pages This differs from general encoding issues because: 1. Specifically affects URI scheme identifiers (the ':' character) 2. Corrupts binary data rather than text paths 3. Requires special handling for RFC-2397 compliance 4. Breaks functionality rather than just aesthetics
